      <description>&lt;p&gt;Built my first all pattern WordPress site. Yes there is a massive chonky JS and CSS implementation but I will die on the hill of â€˜the client does not need to edit the margin and padding of a card elementâ€™ or â€˜edit the header layoutâ€™. I think of it as design system driven development. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;From what i understand even FSE sites need a complex theme.json so again, even with global styles a client is not going to be editing these. As per I still donâ€™t fully get FSEâ€™s place in WordPress development.&lt;/p&gt;</description>

      <description>&lt;p&gt;I knew that a linear gradient was going to be an issue with a build I am doing right now and the designers we going to point out the â€˜sharp edgeâ€™. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;To the MATH and Scrim!&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;TL;DR we need way more stops (13!) in our linear gradient in a Ease-in-out-sine shape&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="https://css-tricks.com/easing-linear-gradients/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" translate="no"&gt;&lt;span class="invisible"&gt;https://&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class="ellipsis"&gt;css-tricks.com/easing-linear-g&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class="invisible"&gt;radients/&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>

      <description>&lt;p&gt;Good initiative but quite worrying this is not apparently being built using GOV.uk design system. Give the breath of this project this surely should be using familiar and well tested design patterns. Also appears to be built using react and 2MB of JavaScript meaning poor performance for mobile users on low powerred devices. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="https://change.nhs.uk/en-GB/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" translate="no"&gt;&lt;span class="invisible"&gt;https://&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class=""&gt;change.nhs.uk/en-GB/&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class="invisible"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>

      <description>&lt;p&gt;I think this is broadly on the nose&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;For most websites and use cases, no-code tools such as Squarespace or Webflow or/and specific product offerings such as Substack or community sites from Mighty Networks / Circle.so will suffice for most small-medium orgs&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;And on the larger org side WordPress is getting squeezed. As the article says it wont disappear &amp;amp; there will be a need for CMS such as WordPress. This is only really extending a trend thats been going for a few years&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href="https://molodtsov.me/2024/10/wordpress-doesnt-matter-for-the-future-of-web/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" translate="no"&gt;&lt;span class="invisible"&gt;https://&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class="ellipsis"&gt;molodtsov.me/2024/10/wordpress&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class="invisible"&gt;-doesnt-matter-for-the-future-of-web/&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>

      <description>&lt;p&gt;OK, day two of trying to see if I can build a native block (React) in WordPress. Again, thanking 10up. &lt;a href="https://github.com/10up/block-components/tree/develop?tab=readme-ov-file" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener noreferrer" translate="no"&gt;&lt;span class="invisible"&gt;https://&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class="ellipsis"&gt;github.com/10up/block-componen&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span class="invisible"&gt;ts/tree/develop?tab=readme-ov-file&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Even with all that amazing stuff I found a bunch of things just really flaky. Like error city. I thought people liked React for its DX? I found it needlessly needy, like theres a plugin for that x1000.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;185 lines of code and I don&amp;#39;t know how many libraries but I have a native drag and drop post list. &lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;Also no way am I rendering this on the FE with React, PHP for that!&lt;/p&gt;</description>
